summary: This document is an email chain from November 23, 2021, between U.S. Attorney's Office (Southern District of New York) personnel discussing a voice message from an individual claiming to have information about Ghislaine Maxwell and to be a friend of George Soros. The protocol is to forward all such tips to the FBI.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: An individual claims to have information about her in a voice message. She is the central figure the tipster is offering information on.

persons.name: George Soros
persons.context: The individual leaving the voice message claims to be a friend of George Soros, though this is an unverified claim mentioned in the tip.

connections.description: A tipster claims to be a friend of George Soros and to have information about Ghislaine Maxwell, implying a potential (though unverified and indirect) social connection is the basis for the offered information.

events.title: Tip received about Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: An individual leaves a voice message claiming to have information about Ghislaine Maxwell and to be a friend of George Soros. The message is forwarded within the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

keyFacts: On November 23, 2021, the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York received a tip via voice message from an individual claiming to have information about Ghislaine Maxwell.
The tipster also claimed to be a friend of billionaire George Soros, though this claim is unverified.
The standard protocol for the office in this case was to forward all tips to the FBI for logging through a specific procedure.
The email chain shows internal coordination about handling unsolicited tips during the Maxwell investigation.
